snippet: Rebecca Soni became the first woman ever to break the 2:20 barrier with a clocking of 2 minutes 19.59 seconds, successfully defending her gold medal in the event from the Beijing Games.
abstract: Rebecca Soni wins the 200-meter breaststroke at the 2012 Olympics, becoming the first woman ever to break the 2 minute 20 second barrier with a clocking of 2 minutes 19.59 seconds; Soni also becomes the first American swimmer, male or female, to successfully defend an Olympic title in the breaststroke.
lead_paragraph: Rebecca Soni became the first woman ever to break the 2:20 barrier with a clocking of 2 minutes 19.59 seconds, successfully defending her gold medal in the event from the Beijing Games.

headline.seo: American Soni Sets World Record to Win 200 Breaststroke
headline.main: Soni Sets World Record to Win 200 Breaststroke
headline.print_headline: Soni of the U.S. Shows How to Defend a Title
